name: Hilton Stockholm Slussen

reviews.title: One of the nicest in the Hitlon chain
reviews.text: A really good Hilton (and I've stayed in a lot of them and they're not all good!) - but pricey. Its well located for Gamla Stan (the old town). Rooms are well appointed but vary in size considerably. The river facing rooms are naturally the best - and some have small balconies. The Hilton bar (the outside bit) is extremely popular with affluent locals and is good fun.
Steaks and burgers at 'Rubys' across the water are recommended too. Best to book.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!

likes.liked: — Very comfortable, nice bathroom in marble, clean

reviews.text: I travel a lot and is a Hiltonhonors Diamond VIP. I can not understad the bad reviews because this hotel is great! I frequently stay there, both on business and weekend-trips. The location is just perfect, 2 minutes walk from the Old Town and right by the Slussen metrostation. The staff is wonderful! During my last stay, Helen from reception called the room and asked if I was satisfied with the room. The executive lounge is a bit small but very cosy. The breakfast is first class. I have always been upgraded and breakfast is free for Diamond VIP:s. I always stay at this hotel during my Stockholm-visits and highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I am not going to re-write all the other reviews on this property. Pretty much they are all right on the money.
reviews.title: Best Location, Nice Staff, & Great Hotel!!

reviews.text: I'll drive a few important points home:
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Slussen Hilton. We did not stay in the Annex portion of the hotel. The hotel is situated very close to the Slussen Metro stop. The hotel restaurant has excellent food. The only drawback is next door is the bar and if you have dinner in the evening when music is playing, you are going to have a hard time hearing one another. The outside bar is frequented by locals and is a great scene. As Gold HHonors members we had free breakfast at the buffet. The buffet selection was vast and the hosts/wait staff were very attentative. The hotel room is nicely appointed. The only downside is if you have a room close to the end of the hotel where the bar is. Expect to hear loud music or bass in your room.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel. Great Location. Excellent Food.
CHristmas party rather than guest staying
reviews.text: In December this hotel prefers to make money out of loud noice Christmas parties with music all night long making it impossible for guest to sleep. Beware and stay clear of this hotel!

reviews.title: Weekend Trip
reviews.text: Arrived back from Stockholm after a long weekend.

reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel!
reviews.text: Flew with Ryanair to Skavasta airport, which is about 100kms from Stockholm. Because of our late arrival (11.25pm) we booked the first night in Nykoping (The Park Inn Hotel), although there was a late bus into Stockholm.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Park Inn hotel was 8/10. Rooms were small but clean & comfortable. Lounge & dining area was lovely. Breakfast (which was included in price was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A Hilton is a Hilton is a Hilton . . . as said on here already, great location overlooking Gamla Stan and from the bar and restaurant you get the most amazing sky and sea views of Stockholm (plus train tracks and the road system which are very industrial chic). The bar is quite expensive (£7 for a vodka and tonic - but it was a great vodka and tonic or two), but if you live in a city (as I do) then just add a a third onto the price you'd pay at home and that's what you're looking at. The bailey's coffees, bar service and breakfast were fantastic though!
reviews.title: Loved Stockholm, But only liked Hilton Stockholm Slussen

likes.liked: — The location, the view form the restaurant, the baileys coffee, the breakfast, clean!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside was the room. Yes it was clean, yes it had bonkers wood pannelling, but it was tiny. As mentioned on here already, if you are shown the way to the gym area and asked to keep walking - I would ask to be shown another room.
reviews.title: Excellent situation and superb views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms in this seperate part of the building are small, with a limited view and on reflection for the price head somewhere else. If it's someone else paying and you really want to stay here - pay more!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I did query the super-small room with the front desk and received a rather sniffy response and was told that as I had booked through Expedia I needed to raise it with them. I was polite about it all and when I pressed a bit further was then shown an executive room which although more spacious was smoking. So we stayed in our compact almost cabin-like room! It didn't hinder our stay too much, and Stockholm is fabulous, but if you're claustrophobic, don't like the thought of having to climb up into your marble bath to shower and balk at the thought of spending over £7 for a pre-dinner snifter, then perhaps try elsewhere.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but expensive.

reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay. We arrived in the early hours of Saturday morning. The front desk took a little while to find us an executive room but we were very pleased with it. We had a tremendous view of the city. The room was compact but had all we needed. The wardrobe doors swing out so that you can hang clothes easily - plenty of storage space. There was an iron and ironing board and small kettle with everything needed to make tea and coffee.
reviews.title: Try somewhere else if you can

reviews.text: Despite the mixed comments here, I booked a two night stay at the Stockholm Hilton. Given the expense and my Hilton Honors status, I hoped as a business traveler, I would be met with a good stay at a well-known and trusted American brand when I arrived after a long day of travel. It was not the case, and I caution any business traveler interested in any degree of creature comforts to avoid the Stockholm Hilton at any cost. For the cost of 3290 SEK per night ($493) not including breakfast, a business traveler has to expect a room larger than a small closet. Even by European standards, this was a tiny shell of a room.
reviews.title: Be warned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving after a late flight from Germany, the hotel clerk was almost apologetic from the moment I approached the desk. They were full up and this was the only room they had. At midnight, I was not about the scour the city for another room. I was being sent to the “special wing” (mentioned here before) which is down a series of steps (no elevator), past the breakfast room, past the exercise center and to a set of second elevators. Upon entering the room, horror struck: the room was about 10 paces from door to window. It was on the street, a street filled with noisy folks coming to and from local restaurants and bars. For good measure, the train or metro (never sure which) came by on a regular basis. Because the room was stuffy, the only way to get any air was to open the windows, so it became a no win game. I tried not to unload on the poor bellman that dragged my bags down the steep flight of stairs, but by the look on his face, I think he had seen this reaction before.
reviews.title: Great location, great city!!

likes.disliked: — The odd set-up and location of some of the 'annexed' rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be fair, the room was clean and looked like it was straight out of a Scandinavian Design catalog. The bathroom was tiny, but decently appointed. But there wasn’t even room to unpack and store my suitcase. The bed was two small twins shoved together (not uncommon in Europe) which were not the worst, but not worth the steep price.
reviews.title: Nice place, convenient location, put some problems

likes.disliked: — Noise from club across the street

reviews.text: On the positive side, the breakfast ($18 US) was very good (lots of US airline personnel there, no doubt in better rooms than mine) and the fitness center was excellent (and free).
reviews.title: Nice suites - don't touch the minibar!!!!

likes.liked: — Location: 5-10 minute walk and you are in the middle of a beautiful shopping area...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps I have myself to blame for not heeding the warnings here, but booking through my corporate travel agency and paying top dollar (plus a Hilton Honors member) I thought would ensure me a decent room. My advice for business travelers is to avoid this hotel unless you like a tiny room on a noisy street at a high price and have no intention of getting any work done. For tourists who plan on spending little time in their room and have no issue with the steep price, the area seemed safe and the staff is pleasant. Just know what you are getting.
reviews.title: smaller than the ship's stateroom
